intro: Jacquemontia evolvuloides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically trumpet-shaped, with five petals, and are usually a deep blue or purple color. Jacquemontia evolvuloides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and climbing habit.
